translation.en: Whether live action or animated, the beasties of The Witcher universe
translation.zh: ‎不论是真人版还是动画版 ‎《猎魔人》宇宙中的野兽

translation.en: possess the power to scare us senseless.
translation.zh: ‎拥有把我们吓得魂飞魄散的能力

translation.en: And that's because they come with a history.
translation.zh: ‎这是因为它们拥有悠久的历史

translation.en: Some have been nesting in our nightmares ever since humans came out of the cave.
translation.zh: ‎有一些自从人类从洞穴中走出 ‎就一直出现在我们的噩梦之中

translation.en: Yes, I, Geralt of Trivia, am back.
translation.zh: ‎没错 本人 利维亚的杰洛特回来了

translation.en: This time, to explore the dark mythological origins
translation.zh:
‎这次我要探寻 ‎《猎魔人：狼之噩梦》中
‎各种怪物的黑暗神秘起源

translation.en: of the monsters in The Witcher Nightmare of the Wolf.
translation.zh:
‎《猎魔人：狼之噩梦》中
‎各种怪物的黑暗神秘起源

translation.en: So get ready, monster hunters.
translation.zh: ‎准备好了 各位怪物猎人

translation.en: Give a light to your witcher
translation.zh: ‎给猎魔人点个赞

translation.en: Leave a comment for your witcher
translation.zh: ‎给猎魔人留个言

translation.en: It's monster mythology
translation.zh: ‎怪物神话即将开讲

translation.en: We already covered the dangerous, vindictive woodland trickster spirit
translation.zh:
‎在之前的《怪物手册》中
‎我们已经介绍林地矮妖

translation.en: called the Leshy in a previous bestiary,
translation.zh: ‎这是一种危险且报复心强的林地邪灵

translation.en: so we'll leave you with this haiku about it,
translation.zh: ‎那我们就用这首俳句来描绘它吧

translation.en: played on top of spooky forest imagery.
translation.zh: ‎外加阴森可怖的森林意象

translation.en: In Slavic forests,
translation.zh: ‎在斯拉夫森林中

translation.en: the beast shifts from tree to wolf.
translation.zh: ‎野兽由树变身为狼

translation.en: Blood rains upon dried leaves.
translation.zh: ‎血淋在干叶上

translation.en: Don't make me say it again.
translation.zh: ‎别让我再说一次

translation.en: Don't mess with trees, y'all.
translation.zh: ‎你们可别去惹树

translation.en: We all know the importance of a good night's sleep,
translation.zh: ‎我们都知道良好睡眠的重要性

translation.en: which makes a monster that stalks your sleep so very frightening.
translation.zh:
‎因此在梦中纠缠你的怪物
‎就显得尤为恐怖

translation.en: Such was the mahr,
translation.zh: ‎比如梦魔

translation.en: a demonic entity that squatted on a person's chest while they slept,
translation.zh: ‎在人入睡之后 蹲坐在人胸口的怪物

translation.en: causing horrifying dreams.
translation.zh: ‎导致无尽的恶梦

translation.en: Despite its name, the mahr was not a horse,
translation.zh: ‎“梦魔”的发音像马 但其实并不是马

translation.en: but rather resembled a kind of goblin.
translation.zh: ‎而是类似于一种小妖精

translation.en: They were, in fact, known to give horses bad dreams too.
translation.zh: ‎其实梦魔也会令马做恶梦

translation.en: Accounts of mahr visitations were widespread throughout Europe,
translation.zh: ‎出现梦魔的记录遍布欧洲

translation.en: from the German mahr to the Norwegian maritt.
translation.zh: ‎从德国梦魔到挪威梦魔

translation.en: Indeed, one famous Norse saga tells of a mahr that crushed a king's head.
translation.zh:
‎在一个挪威传说中
‎梦魔还碾碎了一位国王的头颅

translation.en: But read deeper and you find that his wife took out the hit.
translation.zh:
‎但深入阅读之后
‎你会发现是他的妻子在幕后操纵

translation.en: Yes, mahrs could be hired through conjurers and witches.
translation.zh:
‎没错
‎可以通过魔法师或女巫雇用梦魔

translation.en: Mahrs could shrink down to fit inside keyholes,
translation.zh: ‎梦魔可以缩小到藏在锁孔之中

translation.en: so one defense was to just stop those openings up.
translation.zh: ‎所以一种防御方法是将锁孔堵住

translation.en: Perhaps a less logical defense against mahr intrusion
translation.zh: ‎有一种无厘头的防御梦魔入侵的方法

translation.en: was to pee in a bottle,
translation.zh: ‎是在瓶子里撒尿

translation.en: keep it for three days, and then throw it in a stream.
translation.zh: ‎放置三天 然后倒入溪流之中

translation.en: Yeah, sure.
translation.zh: ‎对 好的

translation.en: You do you.
translation.zh: ‎随你便吧

translation.en: Modern researchers believe that the proliferation of mahr folklore
translation.zh: ‎现代研究者认为 ‎梦魔传说的激增

translation.en: was an attempt to explain the very real phenomenon of sleep paralysis,
translation.zh: ‎梦魔传说的激增 ‎是想要解释真实存在的睡眠瘫痪症

translation.en: which affects up to 20% of humans.
translation.zh: ‎有20%的人类受该疾病影响

translation.en: They can think that, but I'm going to stop up my keyhole
translation.zh:
‎随他们怎么想 ‎不过我反正会把我的锁孔堵住
‎并在瓶里撒尿

translation.en: and pee in a jar anyway.
translation.zh:
‎不过我反正会把我的锁孔堵住
‎并在瓶里撒尿

translation.en: Sleep well, my friends.
translation.zh: ‎安睡吧 我的朋友们

translation.en: Death should be a time for peace and quiet,
translation.zh: ‎死亡应当是平静安宁的时刻

translation.en: so perhaps we can understand
translation.zh: ‎所以也许我们可以理解

translation.en: why the undead, doomed-to-float-the-earth-forever wraith is so darn malevolent.
translation.zh:
‎为何注定永远漂浮在地球上的
‎不死生物妖灵是如此恶毒

translation.en: It's a spectral being, the Scottish cousin of the ghost.
translation.zh:
‎这是一种幽灵生物
‎是鬼魂的苏格兰远亲

translation.en: And like all Scottish cousins,
translation.zh: ‎就像所有的苏格兰远亲一样

translation.en: it's just a wee bit more trouble than its relatives.
translation.zh: ‎只是比亲戚们稍微麻烦一点罢了

translation.en: Accounts of how wraiths form differ,
translation.zh: ‎关于妖灵的形成 说法不一

translation.en: but a Scottish minister in 1691 wrote poetically
translation.zh:
‎但是1691年
‎一位苏格兰大臣富有诗意地描写道

translation.en: that wraiths were the last breath exhaled by a person on the verge of death.
translation.zh:
‎妖灵是人在临死之际
‎呼出的最后一口气

translation.en: But everyone agrees they weren't happy creatures.
translation.zh:
‎但它们并不是欢乐的生物
‎对这一点大家不持异议

translation.en: Even the wraith's name speaks to its deep torment.
translation.zh:
‎即便是妖灵的名称
‎也显示出其深深的痛苦

translation.en: Etymologists have traced it to the Middle English version of "writhe,"
translation.zh:
‎词源学家将该词追溯到
‎中世纪英语“writhe”一词

translation.en: connecting it to "wreaths" and "wrath,"
translation.zh: ‎与“花圈”和“盛怒”两词相关

translation.en: twisted things and emotions, respectively.
translation.zh: ‎分别表示扭曲的事物和情绪

translation.en: They weren't just physically dangerous. They were harbingers of doom.
translation.zh:
‎它们不仅造成实际的危险
‎还象征着厄运

translation.en: According to Scottish folklore,
translation.zh: ‎根据苏格兰民俗传说

translation.en: just seeing a wraith in the afternoon or evening
translation.zh: ‎如果有人在下午或夜晚看到妖灵

translation.en: signified that death would come for the viewer within a year.
translation.zh: ‎预示着此人将在一年内死亡

translation.en: Wraiths eventually became associated with evil water spirits too.
translation.zh: ‎妖灵后来也与水中恶灵相关联

translation.en: Scotland's water wraiths were lanky, female humanoids
translation.zh:
‎苏格兰的水中妖灵
‎是瘦长的雌性人形怪物

translation.en: who lured drunken travelers into a watery grave.
translation.zh: ‎会将醉酒的旅人引入水中坟墓

translation.en: But in conclusion,
translation.zh: ‎总而言之

translation.en: maybe don't go to Scotland.
translation.zh: ‎要不还是别去苏格兰了

translation.en: Certainly don't drop dead there.
translation.zh: ‎当然也别在那里死掉

translation.en: At least not until this whole wraith thing blows over.
translation.zh: ‎至少等妖灵这档子事过去了再说

translation.en: Aside from dragons, the human-wolf hybrid
translation.zh:
‎除了龙之外 ‎人狼混血是西方文化中
‎最古老且连续出现的怪物之一

translation.en: is one of the oldest continuously used monsters that we have in Western culture.
translation.zh:
‎人狼混血是西方文化中
‎最古老且连续出现的怪物之一

translation.en: Most agree that the first reference to a werewolf is in The Epic of Gilgamesh,
translation.zh:
‎多数人认为 ‎最先记载狼人的是
‎《吉尔伽美什史诗》

translation.en: literally the first piece of Western prose in existence.
translation.zh: ‎这是现存最早的西方散文作品

translation.en: In it, Gilgamesh rejects a woman who turned her last man into a wolf.
translation.zh:
‎史诗中写道
‎吉尔伽美什拒绝了一名女子 ‎该女子将她的前一位男人变成了狼

translation.en: Probably a good call.
translation.zh: ‎这大概是一个明智的决定

translation.en: But the Greeks took werewolves to a new level.
translation.zh: ‎但是希腊人将狼人带上了新的高度

translation.en: Most famously, the king Lycaon angered Zeus
translation.zh:
‎最著名的是 ‎莱卡翁国王将一个小孩做成菜肴
‎献给宙斯

translation.en: by serving him a meal made of… a little boy.
translation.zh:
‎莱卡翁国王将一个小孩做成菜肴
‎献给宙斯 ‎这一行为惹怒了宙斯

translation.en: Yikes.
Zeus struck back, turning the king and his sons
translation.zh:
‎宙斯回击 ‎将国王和他的儿子们
‎变成饿狼作为惩罚

translation.en: into ravenous wolves as punishment.
translation.zh:
‎将国王和他的儿子们
‎变成饿狼作为惩罚

translation.en: And cannibalism leading to a wolven curse
translation.zh: ‎然后同类相食导致狼的诅咒

translation.en: is sort of a running theme in the Greek tales.
translation.zh: ‎这似乎成为了希腊传说的一个主题

translation.en: But in the Middle Ages, werewolves were no longer kings and princes.
translation.zh: ‎但在中世纪 狼人不再是国王和王子

translation.en: They were everywhere, common folk, and there are records of them.
translation.zh:
‎而是变得到处都是 普通人
‎而且有许多记录

translation.en: Gilles Garnier, for instance, the Werewolf of Dole,
translation.zh: ‎比如多勒狼人吉勒·加尼耶

translation.en: burned at the stake for killing and eating children,
translation.zh: ‎因杀害和食用儿童而被烧死在柱子上

translation.en: burning being one of the few ways to kill a werewolf.
translation.zh: ‎用火烧是杀死狼人的少数方法之一

translation.en: The individuals accused may have actually been serial killers,
translation.zh:
‎被指控的人
‎其中有一些也许是连环杀人犯

translation.en: but it's likely that others were the victims of werewolf hysteria.
translation.zh: ‎但其余则可能是狼人癔症的受害者

translation.en: Given the werewolf's long history and vast spread,
translation.zh: ‎鉴于狼人的漫长历史和广泛传播

translation.en: it's no surprise that the trigger for wolven transformation has varied.
translation.zh:
‎狼人转化的诱因多种多样
‎大概也就不奇怪了

translation.en: Of course, you probably know about a full moon,
translation.zh: ‎当然 你大概知道月圆之夜

translation.en: but magic belts, pelts, and ointments enchanted by the devil
translation.zh:
‎但是魔法腰带、毛皮
‎以及恶魔施法的药膏

translation.en: have, at some point, served to spark the change.
translation.zh: ‎也曾一度被视为引发转化的火星

translation.en: But maybe most surprising,
translation.zh: ‎但也许最令人意外的是

translation.en: there may be a kernel of truth in this monster myth.
translation.zh: ‎这怪物迷思之中也许有一丝真实

translation.en: An extremely rare condition called hypertrichosis,
translation.zh:
‎有一种罕见的病症叫作
‎“先天性遗传多毛症”

translation.en: AKA werewolf syndrome,
translation.zh: ‎又名狼人综合症

translation.en: causes excess hair growth that looks pretty lupine.
translation.zh: ‎导致毛发过度生长 看起来很像狼

translation.en: So if you do see a werewolf, show some respect.
translation.zh:
‎所以如果你确实看见狼人
‎那也要尊重对方

translation.en: They are, after all, very old.
translation.zh: ‎毕竟对方年纪很大了

translation.en: Wherever humans die, so everywhere,
translation.zh: ‎人类死亡的地方 ‎也就是世界各地

translation.en: there are undead monsters.
translation.zh: ‎都有不死的怪物

translation.en: In Arabia, we've seen the traveler-hunting ghoul.
translation.zh: ‎阿拉伯有猎杀旅人的食尸鬼

translation.en: In Scandinavia, the size-shifting draugr.
translation.zh:
‎在斯堪的纳维亚半岛
‎有会变形的尸鬼

translation.en: Although it didn't appear in Western literature until the 1800s,
translation.zh:
‎“僵尸”这个词
‎虽然到1800年代才进入西方文学

translation.en: it's thought that the word "zombie" originated in a few West African languages
translation.zh:
‎“僵尸”这个词
‎虽然到1800年代才进入西方文学 ‎但是该词
‎被认为是起源于一些西非语言

translation.en: that migrated to Haiti via enslaved African people.
translation.zh: ‎然后通过非洲奴隶传到海地

translation.en: But according to the original Haitian folklore,
translation.zh: ‎但是根据最初的海地民俗传说

translation.en: zombies weren't savage, flesh-eating monsters.
translation.zh: ‎僵尸并不是野蛮的食肉怪物

translation.en: They were pitiful, mindless, captive beings
translation.zh: ‎而是可怜、无意识且被控制的个体

translation.en: created from corpses by a bocor, an unfriendly neighborhood witch doctor,
translation.zh: ‎由附近恶毒的巫医“波哥”用尸体制成

translation.en: and used as free labor.
translation.zh: ‎用作免费劳力

translation.en: They represented eternal slavery
translation.zh: ‎它们代表了对一群人的永久奴役

translation.en: to a people that had endured and cast off
translation.zh:
‎它们代表了对一群人的永久奴役 ‎这群人忍受并摒弃了
‎奴隶制最臭名昭著、最残忍的对待

translation.en: some of the most notoriously brutal conditions that slavery ever created.
translation.zh:
‎这群人忍受并摒弃了
‎奴隶制最臭名昭著、最残忍的对待

translation.en: Weirdly enough, a 1983 study found that a bocor
translation.zh:
‎非常奇怪 一项1983年的研究发现 ‎一位波哥用河豚、蟾蜍毒液
‎和致幻物制成的药物

translation.en: using a concoction made of puffer fish, and toad venoms and hallucinogens
translation.zh:
‎一位波哥用河豚、蟾蜍毒液
‎和致幻物制成的药物

translation.en: could place a person into a zombie-like trance,
translation.zh: ‎能够令一个人进入类似僵尸的状态

translation.en: and I think that combination would probably kill me.
translation.zh: ‎我想这样的组合大概会让我没命

translation.en: But the study is controversial.
translation.zh: ‎但是该研究是有争议性的

translation.en: Throughout the 1960s,
creators took the mindlessness of Haitian zombies and added the ferocity of some other undead creatures.
translation.zh:
‎人们将海地僵尸的无脑
‎与一些其他不死生物的凶猛相结合

translation.en: Don't get me wrong, flesh-eating zombies are amazing,
translation.zh: ‎别误会 吃肉的僵尸很不错

translation.en: but it's worth remembering that the original zombie had an even darker past.
translation.zh:
‎但最初的僵尸有着更为黑暗的过去
‎这也值得大家牢记

translation.en: Japan,
translation.zh: ‎日本

translation.en: a land of extremes.
translation.zh: ‎一个极端的国家

translation.en: On one hand,
translation.zh: ‎一方面

translation.en: they unleashed a grime-licking bathtub monster on the unsuspecting world,
translation.zh:
‎他们对毫无防备的世界
‎放出一种舔食污垢的浴缸怪物

translation.en: and on the other hand,
translation.zh: ‎另一方面

translation.en: they have super adorable fox spirits.
translation.zh: ‎他们有特别可爱的狐狸精

translation.en: Yes, if you're somewhat familiar with Japanese,
translation.zh: ‎没错 如果对日语比较熟悉

translation.en: you may have noticed that Kitsu from Nightmare of the Wolf
translation.zh:
‎你可能已经发现
‎《狼之噩梦》中的小狐

translation.en: sounds remarkably similar to "kitsune,"
translation.zh: ‎与“ 狐”这个词发音很像

translation.en: the Japanese word for both mundane and monstrous foxes.
translation.zh:
‎在日语中
‎这个词涵盖了普通的狐狸与狐狸怪

translation.en: Oh, yeah, and also that she changes into a fox halfway through.
translation.zh:
‎噢 没错 而且片子到一半
‎她变身成了一只狐狸

translation.en: Whatever.
translation.zh: ‎随便吧

translation.en: So, it's likely that Kitsu was inspired by the kawaii kitsune,
translation.zh:
‎所以小狐这个角色
‎可能是受到可爱狐的启发

translation.en: a fox-like trickster spirit that populated the forests of Northeast Asia
translation.zh:
‎这是一种
‎分布在东北亚的狐狸样子的捣蛋妖精

translation.en: under a variety of names.
translation.zh: ‎有许多不同的名字

translation.en: In traditional trickster fashion, they were sometimes benevolent.
translation.zh: ‎传统上看 它们有时候是善意的

translation.en: Celestial messengers even.
translation.zh: ‎有时甚至是天国的使者

translation.en: Of course, they were just as likely
translation.zh:
‎当然它们也可能
‎运用狡诈、变身和幻术

translation.en: to use cunning, shape-shifting, and illusion to rattle their victims' minds,
translation.zh:
‎当然它们也可能
‎运用狡诈、变身和幻术 ‎来蛊惑受害者的心智

translation.en: particularly if those victims were wicked, greedy or drunk.
translation.zh:
‎尤其是当受害者邪恶、贪婪
‎或醉酒的时候

translation.en: We can be whatever we imagine here, Vesemir. We can be rich.
translation.zh:
‎我们在这里想做什么都可以
‎维瑟米尔 ‎我们可以变得富有

translation.en: Together, here,
translation.zh: ‎一起在这里

translation.en: time is nothing.
translation.zh: ‎时间根本不算什么

translation.en: Out there, I can save her.
translation.zh: ‎在那里 我可以救她

translation.en: That's worth more.
translation.zh: ‎这更重要

translation.en: Now, out of my head.
translation.zh: ‎立刻从我头脑里出去

translation.en: Much like Bugs Bunny,
translation.zh: ‎与兔八哥很像

translation.en: the kitsune particularly relish changing into a beautiful woman
translation.zh: ‎狐尤其喜欢变身为美女

translation.en: in order to seduce unsuspecting men, sometimes even marrying them.
translation.zh:
‎以勾引毫不知情的男人
‎有时候甚至嫁给对方

translation.en: Even today in Chinese culture, the word for fox spirit, "húli jīng"
translation.zh: ‎即便在今天的中国文化中 ‎“狐狸精”这个词仍常用于形容第三者

translation.en: is commonly used to call someone a homewrecker.
translation.zh: ‎“狐狸精”这个词仍常用于形容第三者

translation.en: Look, I'm not saying I have a thing for anthropomorphic animals that dress up like women,
translation.zh:
‎我并不是说
‎自己喜欢扮成女性的人形动物

translation.en: but would I rather meet one instead of a bathtub monster?
translation.zh:
‎但相比于浴缸怪物
‎我是否宁愿遇见前者呢？

translation.en: Yes, I would.
translation.zh: ‎是的 没错

translation.en: You can tell how much ancient humans feared being eaten from their monsters.
translation.zh:
‎古人有多么害怕被怪物吃掉
‎这显而易见

translation.en: Take the fearsome manticore,
translation.zh: ‎比如恐怖的蝎尾狮

translation.en: a derivation of the old Persian word for "man-eater."
translation.zh: ‎起源于古波斯语“食人者”

translation.en: This monstrous hybrid typically mashed up the head of a human, the body of a lion, and the tail of a scorpion.
translation.zh:
‎这种杂交怪物
‎通常由人头、狮身和蝎尾组成

translation.en: Although modern variants sometimes add a pair of leathery wings too.
translation.zh:
‎不过现代变体
‎有时会增加一对皮质翅膀

translation.en: As if a scorpion's tail isn't bad enough,
translation.zh: ‎如果蝎子的尾巴还不够狠

translation.en: the manticore could shoot theirs, like arrows.
translation.zh: ‎蝎尾狮可以把尾巴像箭一样射出去

translation.en: And to complete the ferocious look,
translation.zh: ‎为了最终达成这凶狠的样貌

translation.en: the beast was said to have been colored blood-red.
translation.zh: ‎这种野兽据说呈血红色

translation.en: Strangely, the sources say it had a voice like a melody played on pipes,
translation.zh: ‎很奇怪 ‎据说它的声音像笛子演奏出的乐曲

translation.en: sort of like mine.
translation.zh: ‎与我的声音有几分相似

translation.en: Oh, here he comes It's a manticore
translation.zh: ‎噢 它来了 一头蝎尾狮

translation.en: Always violent and feral,
translation.zh: ‎这种怪物一向暴力而野性

translation.en: it's said to prefer a buffet of humans over just one,
translation.zh:
‎据说吃一个人还不够
‎更喜欢吃自助餐

translation.en: and it ate them whole.
translation.zh: ‎还是整个儿吞

translation.en: It became particularly evil in the Middle Ages
translation.zh: ‎在中世纪 它变得尤为邪恶

translation.en: when everything became associated with the devil anyway.
translation.zh: ‎反正当时一切都与恶魔产生了关联

translation.en: But scholars think the manticore may have been a stand-in for a real man-eater,
translation.zh:
‎但是学者们认为
‎蝎尾狮也许是一种真正食人者的替代

translation.en: the Caspian tiger,
translation.zh: ‎里海虎

translation.en: whose fur could look red in the sun.
translation.zh: ‎其皮毛在阳光下会显出红色

translation.en: Monsters are like anything else,
translation.zh: ‎怪物与其他东西一样

translation.en: they have their ups and downs in popular opinion.
translation.zh: ‎在大众观点中 有褒有贬

translation.en: And there's no better example than the griffin,
translation.zh: ‎狮鹫兽就是最好的例子

translation.en: which has an abnormally long history.
translation.zh: ‎它有着异常悠久的历史

translation.en: The first record we have dates back to 3000 B.C. in Persia,
translation.zh:
‎首次记载
‎要追溯到公元前3000年前的波斯

translation.en: although they truly flourished in ancient Greece.
translation.zh: ‎不过真正兴旺是在古希腊

translation.en: With the body of a lion, and the wings and head of an eagle,
translation.zh: ‎它有着狮子的身体、老鹰的翅膀和头

translation.en: thought to be two of nature's noblest creatures,
translation.zh: ‎这两种动物被认为是最高贵的生物

translation.en: the griffin has, at times, enjoyed an association with royalty.
translation.zh: ‎狮鹫兽当时被认为与王室有关

translation.en: You could often find their statues guarding tombs.
translation.zh: ‎经常会看到它们的雕塑守卫着陵墓

translation.en: The beast was known to dig up gold
translation.zh: ‎这种野兽以挖出黄金而为人所知

translation.en: and, oddly for monsters, we know a little bit about its family life.
translation.zh:
‎对于怪物来说很奇怪
‎我们对它的家庭生活有所了解

translation.en: Griffins mated for life.
translation.zh: ‎狮鹫兽交配繁育后代

translation.en: In the Middle Ages, though, griffins seemed slightly less helpful,
translation.zh:
‎不过在中世纪
‎狮鹫兽似乎就不那么有用了

translation.en: slash slightly more bloodthirsty.
translation.zh: ‎也就是说更嗜血一些

translation.en: They were often depicted battling knights,
translation.zh: ‎它们通常被描绘为与骑士作战

translation.en: or even carrying them and their horses to their nests
translation.zh: ‎甚至将骑士和战马带到巢穴之中

translation.en: for their little grifflings to snack upon.
translation.zh: ‎给小狮鹫兽当零食

translation.en: In fact, horses, of all things, were their mortal enemies,
translation.zh: ‎事实上 马是它们的死敌

translation.en: which seems an unfair fight to me.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得这样的战斗不太公平

translation.en: RIP, Roach.
translation.zh: ‎安息吧 洛奇

translation.en: So, what about today?
translation.zh: ‎那今天呢？

translation.en: Judging by Nightmare of the Wolf, I'd say they're still on a monstrous swing.
translation.zh:
‎根据《狼之噩梦》判断
‎我想他们还在到处捕杀怪物

translation.en: Just give it time.
translation.zh: ‎不要着急

translation.en: There you have it, the monstrous menagerie of Nightmare of the Wolf.
translation.zh: ‎《狼之噩梦》的怪物展览到此结束

translation.en: Happy monster hunting.
translation.zh: ‎祝大家捕猎怪物快乐
